script: -Oh, no, no, that's my-- That's my mom. -Oh.
She came here when she found out she was pregnant.
Um, you want to see more photos?
My friend. You know, um, mi amiga.
The girl we left at the hotel.
You know, she smelled like Don Julio and bad choices?
She always does this to me too. She just disappears.
She's like the fantasmo, no? You know fantasmo?
The reason I planned to come on this trip was to find the secret beach...
...and now she's just stuck back at Las Rocas with the Irish flu.
No, I don't. It's just, you know.
It's not fair. You know why, though?
You're not gonna tell me. Cool.
No, no, you're cool. You're being cool.
We were going the same way. I live close, so don't worry.
-Nice to meet you. -Nice to meet you --you know, high school.
...but we didn't have Spanish, just cadavers.
Okay, dark in a few hours, so....
Oh, I never surf at night.
And how you getting out from here?
Thank you again for taking me here.
What did you say the name of it was again?
I just forgot, for some reason.
It's hard to paddle against the current.
I almost got caught on the inside coming out.
Yes, we have surf in Texas. It's just not like this, though.
Hey, this is a secret break. How you find it?
Someone told me about it a while ago.
If I tell you, I would have to kill you.
Well, that would ruin my day.
Anything gnarly out here I should know about?
There's only one tide a day.
When the tide gets low, it becomes an island.
Still have no idea what you're saying.
He's saying that you should come over here.
Oh, I'm okay, I'm okay. I'm cool here, thank you.
It's rough out here for a little girl from Texas.
I think I'll be all right.
Oh, my God. No way. Mom's beach, right?
It's just as beautiful as she said it was.
I wish you were here. I wish she was here.
I wasn't gonna come all this way just to wuss out...
That's how you wind up on Nancy Grace, okay?
I'm supposed to be the boring, overprotective sister.
Sis, the surf here, it's insane.
You would not believe the perfect tube I just caught.
I could shoot tubes just as good as you...
...if you would just take me out!
I'll take you out as soon as I get back.
-I love you too. MAN: Is that Nancy?
I don't know what to say, Nance. I'm at a loss. Heh, heh.
-I can't understand. -I don't expect you to.
I don't know. What do you want me to say?
Say you're not dropping out of med school after all this time and work.
-You know, just don't quit. -Okay. Okay, Dad.
That's enough. Can we not do this right now?
It's what you love. You help people.
Not everyone can be helped, Dad. You know that.
-Don't make this about her. -What else would it be about?
If you want to make this about her, then you stay in it.
It's just she fought too hard, Dad.
Yeah, girl, it's getting late. Let's go in.
I'm gonna catch one last one. Thanks.
-Nice meeting you guys. SURFER: See you later, guera.
You're not gonna feel a thing.
I just put some Novocain injections...
...you're gonna feel a little pressure, but...
...you're not gonna feel the stitches, okay?
Tie off the suture. Oh, yeah.
That's a nice-- that's a nice union.
One more, and then we'll send you on your way.
Just keep it elevated, ma'am. Someone's coming.
Let's loosen this tourniquet for you.
Okay, you get two minutes of blood flow.
Come back, you can have it!
Wait! It's okay! Just don't go!
Stop! Get out of the water!
Don't worry about it! There's no sharks here!
Come on, come on! Swim! Come on!
I got you! Come on! Come on!
I'm not very good at ortho...
...but it just looks like a dislocation.
I'm just gonna do this quick, okay?
It's gonna hurt just for a second...
That's a terrible way to say thank you.
Now you've got a chance, huh?
32 seconds from the whale to the rock.
I got you! I got you!
If you find this, please send help right away.
I've been attacked by a shark.
He's killed three other people since I got here.
He's got this big old whale over here...
...but that's the problem, I swam right up on his feeding ground.
I have a-- A deep gash running vertically...
...and then it turns lateral, just above my knee.
And right here, there's one going across my posterior calf.
I'm losing a lot of blood. Gangrene is setting in.
I feel like I'm losing my strength.
I don't think I have much time.
The island I'm on is gonna be taken by the tide in a few minutes.
I'm about 200 yards off the shore.
I never found out what it was called.
...which I'm gonna try to swim to...
If you find this can you just-- Can you just delete that first part...
...and send it to 10231 Oliver Crescent Drive...
That's where my dad and sister live.
I finally got that alone time.
I mean, I'm not totally alone.
Steven Seagull here, keeping me company.
I fixed him for you, Chlo.
I just don't want you guys to worry, and I don't want you to feel...
And I miss you more than I ever-- I ever even realized I could.
Dad, I gotta get off this rock soon.
But I want you to know I'm gonna fight.
It's okay. It's okay. You got it. Good job.
You didn't like that, because it stings like jellyfish.
No, no, no, come back. Come back.
If you find this, please send help right away.
I've been attacked by a shark.
He's killed three other people since I got here.
I'm losing a lot of blood.
I feel like I'm losing my strength.
CHLOE: No way. Mom's beach, right?
NANCY: Not everyone can be helped.
I don't want you to feel, you know, bad or anything.
-I gotta go, Dad. See you later. FATHER: Hey, sweet pea.
NANCY: Never found out.... FATHER: She was a fighter....
NANCY: I'm gonna fight, just like she taught us.
Ready to get wet, Dr. Adams?
Ma would be proud of you. Both of you.
Do you think I'll ever be as good as you?
